conclusion: Cars A and B are traveling in the same direction on a straight road.
The two cars are side by side at \\( t = 30 \\) seconds.
The v-t graphs show the velocity of Cars A and B over time.
The v-t graph shows Car A's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 40 m/s over 10 seconds and then remaining constant at 40 m/s.
The v-t graph shows Car B's velocity increasing linearly from 0 to 20 m/s over 10 seconds and then remaining constant at 20 m/s.
Calculate the displacement of Car A from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds using the area of the triangle formed by the v-t graph.
The area of the triangle for Car A is \\( \frac{1}{2} \times 10 \, \text{s} \times 40 \, \text{m/s} = 200 \, \text{m} \\).
Calculate the displacement of Car B from \\( t = 0 \\) to \\( t = 10 \\) seconds using the area of the triangle formed by the v-t graph.
The area of the triangle for Car B is \\( \frac{1}{2} \times 10 \, \text{s} \times 20 \, \text{m/s} = 100 \, \text{m} \\).
Compare the displacements of Car A and Car B at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
Car A has traveled 200 meters and Car B has traveled 100 meters at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
Since 200 meters (Car A) is greater than 100 meters (Car B), Car A is ahead of Car B at \\( t = 10 \\) seconds.
